hero.name: James Marriott
hero.heading: Full-Stack Developer
hero.subheading: Creating scalable web applications with React, TypeScript, and Node.js

aboutMe.heading: About Me
aboutMe.description: As a Full Stack Developer, I focus on delivering high-performance, enterprise-level web applications. I build user-centric front-end interfaces, driving development through rapid prototyping, quick iterations, test environments, and integrating user feedback in close collaboration with design teams. My work prioritizes an optimized user experience by leveraging server-side rendering, efficient data fetching, to create performant applications.

expertise.heading: My Expertise
expertise.description: With over 5 years of experience in full-stack development, I excel in building enterprise-level applications that prioritize user experience and performance. My technical expertise spans both frontend and backend development, with a focus on creating scalable, maintainable solutions using modern frameworks and tools. I'm particularly skilled in Next.js implementations, GraphQL, and microservice architectures. I understand the importance of balancing technical excellence with business requirements, and I'm committed to delivering solutions that meet both user needs and organizational goals. Whether it's optimizing database structures, implementing efficient server-side integrations, or creating responsive user interfaces, I approach each project with a pragmatic mindset and a focus on delivering value.

tech.heading: Tech Stack
tech.description: I work with a wide range of technologies across the full development stack.

projects.heading: My Projects
projects.description: Here are some of the projects I've worked on. Each represents a unique challenge and learning experience.

projectOne.title: Portfolio Website
projectOne.description: A responsive portfolio website built with Next.js, featuring GSAP animations and multi-language support.

projectTwo.title: E-commerce Platform
projectTwo.description: A full-featured online store with user authentication, product management, and payment processing.

projectThree.title: Mobile App
projectThree.description: A cross-platform mobile application built with React Native for both iOS and Android devices.

work.heading: Work Experience
work.subheading: My professional journey and the companies I've worked with.

company1.name: Ducky
company1.shortDescription: Leading software development for enterprise-level sustainability solutions
company1.description: As a Senior Software Developer at Ducky, I lead development of React/Next.js applications and architected Python/Flask-based microservices for natural language processing. Promoted to Senior Developer following appraisal and interview process recognizing significant impact and technical leadership.

responsibilities.title: Key Responsibilities
responsibilities.content: Leading development of React/Next.js applications, architecting Python/Flask microservice architecture on Google Cloud, developing RESTful backend API services, and ensuring comprehensive test coverage with Vitest and React Testing Library.

achievements.title: Achievements
achievements.content: Promoted to Senior Developer role, spearheaded transition from web-component design system to shadcn + Tailwind reducing development time significantly, delivered high-performance SPAs with Next.js, and integrated complex 3rd party ERP systems including Visma Connect.

technologies.title: Technologies Used
technologies.content: React, Next.js, TypeScript, Python, Flask, GraphQL, Apollo, PostgreSQL, Prisma ORM, Google Cloud, shadcn, Tailwind CSS, GitHub Actions, and Cloud Build.

company2.name: Oslo Nye Fagskole AS
company2.shortDescription: Teaching web development fundamentals at vocational school
company2.description: Led development and delivery of comprehensive Front End & Web Essentials curriculum, including all media content for core courses. Provided extensive student support and 1:1 mentoring to junior developers.

achievements.title: Key Achievements
achievements.content: Developed comprehensive Front End & Web Essentials curriculum from ground up, provided extensive student support in both Front End and Back End Essentials, and consistently achieved high student satisfaction ratings with exceptional feedback on one-on-one mentoring sessions.

company3.name: Digital Freelancer
company3.shortDescription: Independent contractor providing web development and educational services
company3.description: Worked as independent contractor providing web development and educational services to small businesses, designing and developing custom websites and creating educational content.

highlights.title: Highlights
highlights.content: Designed, developed, and delivered over 15 client websites across diverse industries, produced engaging educational content and interactive web-based games using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and WordPress, and cultivated strong long-term client relationships with consistently high satisfaction rates.

projects.heading: Projects
projects.subheading: Some of my recent work and personal projects.

projects.title: Wood For Good
projects.subtitle: Sustainable Furniture Platform
projects.shortDescription: A dual-revenue platform combining interactive 3D visualization technology with an ecommerce system for sustainable furniture
projects.description: Wood For Good is a scalable platform combining interactive 3D visualization technology with an ecommerce system to address opportunities in the sustainable furniture market. The business implements a freemium model with dual revenue streams: free access to 3D woodworking tutorials that drives user acquisition, and premium revenue from pre-cut furniture kits made from reclaimed and sustainable wood sources. The system leverages modern web technologies to create a technical and business solution that aligns market demand for high quality furniture at low prices with environmental sustainability goals.

sections.title: Technical Architecture
sections.content: The platform is built on a Next.js/TypeScript stack with Three.js integration for real-time 3D rendering. The architecture features a headless ecommerce implementation with custom inventory management for both digital assets (3D models) and physical products (pre-cut kits). The system is deployed on Vercel with CI/CD pipelines for rapid iteration and includes comprehensive analytics tracking for user engagement and conversion optimization.

sections.title: Market Opportunity & Business Model
sections.content: Wood For Good targets two growing market segments: DIY furniture enthusiasts and sustainability-conscious consumers. The freemium model uses no-cost 3D tutorials as a user acquisition funnel, driving conversions to the premium pre-cut kit offerings. This approach delivers high-margin revenue from the physical products while creating scalable growth through the digital content. Initial testing shows a 12% conversion rate from tutorial users to kit purchasers.

sections.title: Supply Chain Innovation
sections.content: The venture implements a circular economy approach to materials sourcing, establishing partnerships with construction companies and furniture manufacturers to reclaim high-quality wood that would otherwise be discarded. This gives the business a competitive advantage on both costs and sustainability metrics. The supply chain management system integrates with the ecommerce backend, automatically updating inventory and triggering new material acquisition based on sales velocity.

sections.title: Technology Differentiation
sections.content: The platform's key technical differentiator is its proprietary 3D visualization engine that allows non-technical users to interact with complex woodworking designs. The system implements optimized WebGL rendering for cross-device compatibility and uses custom geometry algorithms to ensure accurate visualization of joinery details and assembly sequences. This technology creates significant barriers to entry for potential competitors.

sections.title: Scaling Strategy
sections.content: The current development roadmap focuses on three core areas for scaling: 1) Expanding the project library through an optimized content creation pipeline, 2) Implementing a partner API to allow third-party designers to contribute projects and receive revenue share, and 3) Developing logistics optimization for the physical product distribution to support international expansion. The system architecture has been designed to support 10x growth with minimal refactoring.
